description.description: Template description displayed on the right side of template selector

category.description: Template category. '/' character can be used to define multiple levels of categories, i.e. 'TypeScript/Extensions'

iconLight.description: Name of the icon file used with light Visual Studio Code theme

iconDark.description: Name of the icon file used with dark Visual Studio Code theme

targetName.description: Name of generated file. Template engine variables can be used here.

replaceParameters.description: Specifies if template engine variables should be replaced with their values inside the file.

open.description: Specifies if output file should be opened automatically by Visual Studio Code.

isProject.description: Specifies if it is project (true) or project item (false) template.

command.description: OS command to be run at the end of files generation.

items.description: Command parameter. Template engine variables can be used here.

openFiles.description: List of files that should be opened after they are generated. It can be used to open files generated by OS command defined in 'command' property.

items.description: Name of the file that should be opened by Visual Studio Code.

settingsProcessors.description: List of settings processors that should be run with this template. Settings processors can create additional variables and it makes sense to run them only if they are required, i.e. we don't need .net specific variables for type script templates.

wizardName.description: Name of wizard that will be run after template is selected
